citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The following cats have medical problems:
98112011806778 – Male leopard cat named “Cloud”. This cat was squinting his left eye and has ocular discharge present
in the corners of both eyes. This cat had a formed stool in the cage.
98511201180660 – Male leopard cat named “Bobby”. This cat is slender and continues to have semi-formed stool.
985141005227690 – Male kitten unnamed. This cat continues to have diarrhea. This cat was also observed to have head
tremors and is unsteady at times when walking. He was observed to be leaning against the wall of the enclosure at times
when he walked. Inspectors verified with the attending veterinarian that he examined this kitten and directed her to treat
with prednisolone and Clavamox. The licensee states that she did not treat the kitten with prednisolone and did not seek
medical consultation with a veterinary specialist.
985112011806548 – Female cat “Ariel”. This cat is slender. There is diarrhea in the litter box in this enclosure. This cat
was examined by the attending veterinarian on 6 March 2023. Inspectors consulted with this veterinarian. He stated that
he directed the licensee to treat this cat with metronidazole. The licensee stated that she is not treating this cat with any
medications at this time.
985141005229824 – Female leopard cat “Lady”. This cat appears to be thinner since the inspection on 3 March. Her hip
bones are prominent and her spine visible. The caretaker for the facility agrees that this cat appears to be thinner. This
cat was examined by the attending veterinarian on 6 March 2023. Inspectors consulted with this veterinarian. He stated
that he directed the licensee to treat this cat with Clavamox and “Methigel”. The licensee stated that she is not treating
this cat with any medications at this time.
046868541 - Male leopard cat “Roman”
985141004667596 - Female cat “Izzy”
985141003970662 - Female cat “Sierra”
These cats continue to have soft stool in the litter box.
985112011806473 – Female leopard cat - unnamed
985141005229824 – female cat “Lacy”
985112010103417 – female cat “Sofie”
991001004713780 – female cat “Pebbles”
985141003971325 – female cat “Cheyanne”
These five cats share an enclosure and had diarrhea in and on the side of the litter box.
985141004666850 - Female cat “Egypt”
985141005790943 – Female kitten
985141005790883 – male kitten
985141005230223 – male kitten
985141005794054 – male kitten
985141004662109 – male kitten
The attending veterinarian stated to inspectors that he directed the licensee on 6 March 2023 to treat all kittens and any
that share a litter box with Albon. The licensee stated that she has not treated the kittens and the mother with this
medication since that time.
Inspectors consulted with the attending veterinarian about the care of the cats in general. He stated that he directed the
licensee on 6 March 2023 to treat all cats with diarrhea with azithromycin. The licensee states that she has ordered the
medication and expects it to be delivered today. She had not started this medication as of the time of the inspection. The
veterinarian was aware that this medication has not been given to the cats yet.
Failure to address medical problems or to treat animals as directed by the veterinarian results in ongoing disease and
unrelieved suffering.
The licensee must have all of these animals examined in person by a veterinarian within 1 hour of the receipt of this
report.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee and facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Gustavo Soberano, Assistant Director
Gervais Edmonds-Wiggins, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
BRENTON COX, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOREnd Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The following cats have medical problems: 
98112011806778 – Male leopard cat named “Cloud”. This cat was squinting his left eye and has ocular discharge present 
in the corners of both eyes. This cat had a formed stool in the cage. 
 
98511201180660 – Male leopard cat named “Bobby”. This cat is slender and continues to have semi-formed stool.  
 
985141005227690 – Male kitten unnamed. This cat continues to have diarrhea. This cat was also observed to have head 
tremors and is unsteady at times when walking. He was observed to be leaning against the wall of the enclosure at times 
when he walked. Inspectors verified with the attending veterinarian that he examined this kitten and directed her to treat 
with prednisolone and Clavamox. The licensee states that she did not treat the kitten with prednisolone and did not seek 
medical consultation with a veterinary specialist.  
 
985112011806548 – Female cat “Ariel”. This cat is slender. There is diarrhea in the litter box in this enclosure. This cat 
was examined by the attending veterinarian on 6 March 2023. Inspectors consulted with this veterinarian. He stated that

he directed the licensee to treat this cat with metronidazole. The licensee stated that she is not treating this cat with any 
medications at this time.  
 
985141005229824 – Female leopard cat “Lady”. This cat appears to be thinner since the inspection on 3 March. Her hip 
bones are prominent and her spine visible. The caretaker for the facility agrees that this cat appears to be thinner. This 
cat was examined by the attending veterinarian on 6 March 2023. Inspectors consulted with this veterinarian. He stated 
that he directed the licensee to treat this cat with Clavamox and “Methigel”. The licensee stated that she is not treating 
this cat with any medications at this time.  
 
046868541 - Male leopard cat “Roman”  
985141004667596 - Female cat “Izzy” 
985141003970662 - Female cat “Sierra”  
These cats continue to have soft stool in the litter box. 
 
985112011806473 – Female leopard cat - unnamed 
985141005229824 – female cat “Lacy” 
985112010103417 – female cat “Sofie” 
991001004713780 – female cat “Pebbles” 
985141003971325 – female cat “Cheyanne” 
These five cats share an enclosure and had diarrhea in and on the side of the litter box.

985141004666850 - Female cat “Egypt” 
985141005790943 – Female kitten 
985141005790883 – male kitten 
985141005230223 – male kitten 
985141005794054 – male kitten 
985141004662109 – male kitten 
The attending veterinarian stated to inspectors that he directed the licensee on 6 March 2023 to treat all kittens and any 
that share a litter box with Albon. The licensee stated that she has not treated the kittens and the mother with this 
medication since that time. 
  
Inspectors consulted with the attending veterinarian about the care of the cats in general. He stated that he directed the 
licensee on 6 March 2023 to treat all cats with diarrhea with azithromycin. The licensee states that she has ordered the 
medication and expects it to be delivered today. She had not started this medication as of the time of the inspection. The 
veterinarian was aware that this medication has not been given to the cats yet.  
 
Failure to address medical problems or to treat animals as directed by the veterinarian results in ongoing disease and 
unrelieved suffering.  
 
The licensee must have all of these animals examined in person by a veterinarian within 1 hour of the receipt of this 
report. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee and facility representative.

Additional Inspectors: 
Gustavo Soberano, Assistant Director 
Gervais Edmonds-Wiggins, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
